turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Voalte.
turn.2: Voalte  Voalte is a clinical communication software company headquartered in Sarasota, Florida.
turn.4: Voalte was founded in 2008 by Trey Lauderdale, Oscar Callejas, Benjamin King, and former Microsoft and Apple executive Rob Campbell.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: In October 2012, the company received $6 million in funding to increase the company size to 150 by the end of 2013 and continue product development.
turn.7: What were some of the products developed?
turn.8: Voalte currently has more than 60,000 Apple iPhones, Zebra MC40-HCs, Spectralink PIVOTs and Honeywell Dolphin CT50hs installed in 290 hospitals nationwide, which are used by 215,000 healthcare professionals.
turn.9: What were some of the hospitals or clinics where this was implemented?
turn.10: The deployments range from 25 phones to 3,800 phones in health systems with multiple facilities.
turn.11: What were some of the major hospitals?
turn.12: Voalte is installed in hospitals such as The University of Iowa Hospitals and Clinics, Cedars-Sinai Medical Center, Texas Children's Hospital, and Sarasota Memorial Health Care System.
